patient_info: Syncope,Hepatic cysts,Ascites,Abnormal mitral valve morphology,Cardiomegaly,Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology,Abnormal aortic valve morphology,Tachycardia,Mitral regurgitation,Pericardial effusion,Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology,Right ventricular failure,Third degree atrioventricular block,Abnormal left ventricle morphology,Pleural effusion,Sleep disturbance,Episodic vomiting,Conjugated hyperbilirubinemia,Hypoalbuminemia,Elevated circulating creatine kinase concentration,Fatigable weakness,Exercise intolerance,Increased total bilirubin,Increased body weight,Poor appetite,Tricuspid regurgitation,Loss of consciousness,Abnormal ventricular septum morphology,Pedal edema,Decreased urine output,Regional left ventricular wall motion abnormality,Orthopnea,Left ventricular diastolic dysfunction,Right atrial enlargement,Increased circulating creatine kinase MB isoform
golden_diagnosis: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 10,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia 12,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 9,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 8,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 11,Naxos disease/Naxos disease,Desminopathy/Myopathy, myofibrillar, 1,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 2,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 5,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 1,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 4,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 3,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 6,Desminopathy/Myopathy, myofibrillar, 1,致心律失常性右室发育不良/心肌病（ARVD/C）/Arrhythmogenic right ventriculardysplasia/ cardiomyopathy; ARVD/C,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 13
predict_diagnosis:
1. Primary hypoxemia caused by abnormal pulmonary valve morphology and abnormal mitral valve morphology leading to poor oxygenation of the body.
2. Hypertension secondary to the rare disease and an inguinal hernia.
3. Cardiomyopathy secondary to the rare disease, left ventricular hypertrophy, and abnormal aortic and tricuspid valve morphology.
4. Aneurysm of the ascending tubular aorta and abnormal left ventricular function due to the rare disease.
5. Enlarged liver secondary to the rare disease and hepatocellular carcinoma.
6. Hypertensive urgency secondary to the rare disease and inguinal hernia.
7. Tachycardia caused by abnormal mitral valve regurgitation and tachycardia.
8. Pericardial effusion secondary to the rare disease and increased total bilirubin.
9. Episodic vomiting caused by conjugated hyperbilirubinemia and increased body weight.
10. Hypoalbuminemia caused by the rare disease and increased total bilirubin.
